Title: RHSA-2020:1769: kernel security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Important)
Description:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: use-after-free in __blk_add_trace in kernel/trace/blktrace.c (CVE-2019-19768)

* kernel: nfs: NULL pointer dereference due to an anomalized NFS message sequence (CVE-2018-16871)

* kernel: memory leak in the kernel_read_file function in fs/exec.c allows to cause a denial of service (CVE-2019-8980)

* kernel: unprivileged users able to create RAW sockets  in AF_IEEE802154 network protocol. (CVE-2019-17053)

* kernel: unprivileged users able to create RAW sockets in AF_ISDN  network protocol. (CVE-2019-17055)

* kernel: integer overflow in tcp_ack_update_rtt in net/ipv4/tcp_input.c (CVE-2019-18805)

* kernel: information leak bug caused  by a malicious USB device in the drivers/net/can/usb/peak_usb/pcan_usb_core.c driver (CVE-2019-19534)

* kernel: some ipv6 protocols not encrypted over ipsec tunnel. (CVE-2020-1749)

* Kernel: net: using kernel space address bits to derive IP ID may potentially break KASLR (CVE-2019-10639)

* kernel: An out-of-bounds read in drivers/scsi/qedi/qedi_dbg.c leading to crash or information disclosure (CVE-2019-15090)

* kernel: a NULL pointer dereference in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath10k/usb.c leads to a crash (CVE-2019-15099)

* kernel: Null pointer dereference in the sound/usb/line6/pcm.c (CVE-2019-15221)

* kernel: Two memory leaks in the mwifiex_pcie_init_evt_ring() function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/pcie.c allows for a DoS (CVE-2019-19057)

* kernel: Memory leaks in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath9k/htc_hst.c in the Linux kernel (DOS) (CVE-2019-19073)

* kernel: a memory leak in the ath9k management function in allows local DoS (CVE-2019-19074)

* kernel: when cpu.cfs_quota_us is used allows attackers to cause a denial of service against non-cpu-bound applications (CVE-2019-19922)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

This update also fixes several bugs and adds various enhancements. Documentation for these changes is available from the Release Notes document linked to in the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: CVE-2018-16871 kernel: nfs: NULL pointer dereference due to an anomalized NFS message sequence
CVE-2019-8980 kernel: memory leak in the kernel_read_file function in fs/exec.c allows to cause a denial of service
CVE-2019-10639 Kernel: net: using kernel space address bits to derive IP ID may potentially break KASLR
L2 guest hit kernel panic when do L1->L1 live migration on PML-enabled intel host
CVE-2019-15090 kernel: An out-of-bounds read in drivers/scsi/qedi/qedi_dbg.c leading to crash or information disclosure
CVE-2019-15099 kernel: a NULL pointer dereference in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath10k/usb.c leads to a crash
kernel: brk can grow the heap into the area reserved for the stack
CVE-2019-15221 kernel: Null pointer dereference in the sound/usb/line6/pcm.c
conntrack tool delete entry with CIDR crash
fix compat statfs64() returning EOVERFLOW for when _FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64
CVE-2019-17053 kernel: unprivileged users able to create RAW sockets  in AF_IEEE802154 network protocol.
CVE-2019-17055 kernel: unprivileged users able to create RAW sockets in AF_ISDN  network protocol.
Fallocate on XFS may discard concurrent AIO write
Backport CIFS stale ESTALE handling and dentry revalidation patches
svcrdma: Increase the default connection credit limit
CVE-2019-18805 kernel: integer overflow in tcp_ack_update_rtt in net/ipv4/tcp_input.c
Process killed while opening a file can result in leaked open handle on the server
CVE-2019-19074 kernel: a memory leak in the ath9k management function in allows local DoS
CVE-2019-19073 kernel: Memory leaks in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath9k/htc_hst.c in the Linux kernel (DOS)
CVE-2019-19057 kernel: Two memory leaks in the mwifiex_pcie_init_evt_ring() function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/pcie.c allows for a DoS
CVE-2019-19534 kernel: information leak bug caused  by a malicious USB device in the drivers/net/can/usb/peak_usb/pcan_usb_core.c driver
CVE-2019-19768 kernel: use-after-free in __blk_add_trace in kernel/trace/blktrace.c
kernel: Wrong FE0/FE1 MSR restore in signal handlers on ppc64le
CVE-2019-19922 kernel: when cpu.cfs_quota_us is used allows attackers to cause a denial of service against non-cpu-bound applications
RHEL8: Latency issue on Kubernetes / k8s / OpenShift
[NFS] Dataloss with copy_file_range on NFS-mounted files that is not 4K aligned  on RHEL 8.
CVE-2020-1749 kernel: some ipv6 protocols not encrypted over ipsec tunnel.
